metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: HTML SVG Graphics
SVG (Scalable Vector Graphics)

links.text: SVG defines vector-based graphics in XML

content.text: SVG defines vector-based graphics in XML , which can be directly embedded in HTML pages.
content.html: SVG defines vector-based graphics in XML, which can be directly embedded in HTML pages.

content.text: SVG graphics are scalable, and do not lose any quality if they are zoomed or resized:
content.html: SVG graphics are scalable, and do not lose any quality if they are zoomed or resized:

content.text: SVG is supported by all major browsers.
content.html: SVG is supported by all major browsers.

content.text: What is SVG?
The <svg> Element
The HTML <svg> element is a container for SVG graphics.
content.html: The HTML <svg> element is a container for SVG graphics.

content.text: SVG has several methods for drawing paths, rectangles, circles, polygons, text, and much more.
content.html: SVG has several methods for drawing paths, rectangles, circles, polygons, text, and much more.

content.text: SVG Circle

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" 
 stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />

cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" 
 stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" /

content.code:
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
<body>

<svg 
width="100" height="100">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" stroke="green" 
stroke-width="4" fill="yellow" />
</svg>

</body>
</html>

 /

</svg>

content.text: SVG Rectangle with Opacity and Rounded Corners

syntaxHighlighting.text:
<rect x="50" y="20" rx="20" ry="20" 
 width="150" height="150"  
 style="fill:red;stroke:black;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" />

x="50" y="20" rx="20" ry="20" 
 width="150" height="150"  
 style="fill:red;stroke:black;stroke-width:5;opacity:0.5" /

</svg>

content.text: SVG Star

content.code_html:
<svg width="300" height="200">
  <polygon points="100,10 40,198 190,78 10,78 160,198"
  style="fill:lime;stroke:purple;stroke-width:5;fill-rule:evenodd;" />
</svg>

content.text: SVG Gradient Ellipse and Text

content.code:
<svg height="130" width="500">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="grad1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="yellow" 
/>
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="red" />


</linearGradient>
  </defs>
  <ellipse cx="100" cy="70" rx="85" ry="55" 
fill="url(#grad1)" />
  <text fill="#ffffff" font-size="45" 
font-family="Verdana" x="50" y="86">SVG</text>
  Sorry, your browser does not 
support inline SVG.
</svg>
content.code_html:
<svg height="130" width="500">
  <defs>
    <linearGradient id="grad1">
      <stop offset="0%" stop-color="yellow" />
      <stop offset="100%" stop-color="red" />
    </linearGradient>
  </defs>
  <ellipse cx="100" cy="70" rx="85" ry="55" fill="url(#grad1)" />
  <text fill="#ffffff" font-size="45" font-family="Verdana" x="50" y="86">SVG</text>
  Sorry, your browser does not support inline SVG.
</svg>

content.text: Differences Between SVG and Canvas
SVG is a language for describing 2D graphics in XML, while Canvas draws 2D graphics, on the fly (with JavaScript).
content.html: SVG is a language for describing 2D graphics in XML, while Canvas draws 2D graphics, on the fly (with JavaScript).

content.text: SVG is XML based, which means that every element is available within the SVG DOM. You can attach JavaScript event handlers to SVG graphics.
content.html: SVG is XML based, which means that every element is available within the SVG DOM. You can attach JavaScript event handlers to SVG graphics.

content.text: In SVG, each drawn shape is remembered as an object. If attributes of an SVG object are changed, the browser can automatically re-render the shape.
content.html: In SVG, each drawn shape is remembered as an object. If attributes of an SVG object are changed, the browser can automatically re-render the shape.

content.text: Canvas is rendered pixel by pixel. In canvas, once the graphic is drawn, it is forgotten by the browser. If its position should be changed, the entire scene needs to be redrawn, including any objects that might have been covered by the graphic.
content.html: Canvas is rendered pixel by pixel. In canvas, once the graphic is drawn, it is forgotten by the browser. If its position should be changed, the entire scene needs to be redrawn, including any objects that might have been covered by the graphic.

content.text: Comparison of SVG and Canvas
The table below shows some important differences between Canvas and SVG:
content.html: The table below shows some important differences between Canvas and SVG:

content.code_html:
SVG Canvas
  • Resolution independent
  • Support for event handlers
  • Good text rendering capabilities
  • Slow rendering if complex
  • Not suited for game applications
  • Resolution dependent
  • No support for event handlers
  • Poor text rendering capabilities
  • You can save the resulting image as .png or .jpg
  • Well suited for graphic-intensive games

content.text: SVG Tutorial
To learn more about SVG, please read our SVG Tutorial .
content.html: To learn more about SVG, please read our SVG Tutorial.
